item.title: ECB’s Centeno Says Inflation in the Euro-Area Is Under Control
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- Inflation in the euro-area is under control, European Central Bank Governing Council member Mario Centeno said. “Generically, inflation is controlled,” Centeno said in an interview with Portuguese TV channel RTP3 on Wednesday night. “If we look at the next months, quarters, year and a...

item.title: Fidelity Launches Key China Fund in Bet on Retirement Boom
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- Fidelity International Ltd., one of the world’s biggest pension managers, is taking a key first step in the Chinese market to tap a growing thirst for retirement solutions as the aging of the world’s second-largest population quickens. ​ The firm’s Shanghai-based unit said on Thursda...

item.title: BlackRock Promotes Senior Executives Amid Wiedman’s Exit
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- BlackRock Inc. is elevating several senior executives to expand its business in the Americas and with key institutional clients, following the announced departure of Mark Wiedman, once seen as a potential successor to Chief Executive Officer Larry Fink. Joe DeVico will become head of ...

item.title: Emerging Markets Face Further Losses on Trump Tariffs, UBS Says
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- Emerging-market equities and currencies are vulnerable to further losses as the recent selloff hasn’t fully priced in risks arising from Donald Trump’s potential tariffs, according to UBS Group AG. The UBS Emerging Markets Risk Appetite Index stands about halfway between neutral and e...

item.title: BlackRock Gets Record Client Cash, Revamps Leadership Team
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- BlackRock Inc. attracted an annual record of $641 billion in client cash, underlining the firm’s global reach across public and, increasingly, private assets as it integrates multibillion-dollar acquisitions and reshapes its leadership. The tally included $390 billion flowing into its...

item.title: ECB Will Keep Easing With Economy Losing Momentum, Guindos Says
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- The European Central Bank will continue lowering interest rates as the region’s economy struggles to grow, according to Vice President Luis de Guindos. “The policy trajectory is clear, and we expect to continue to further reduce the restrictiveness of monetary policy,” Guindos said We...

item.title: ECB’s Villeroy Says Makes Sense to Cut Rates to 2% by Summer
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- The European Central Bank should continue to cut interest rates to reach 2% by the summer as the battle against inflation is practically won, Governing Council member Francois Villeroy de Galhau said. The French central bank chief said the neutral rate — a theoretical level that neit...

item.title: ECB’s Lane Says FX Matters Even If Firms Absorb Initial Swings
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- The exchange rate matters for the euro-area economy over time, though monthly movements in currency are typically absorbed by companies, European Central Bank Chief Economist Philip Lane said. “Euro-dollar movements over time — of course if it’s permanent — will filter through to pric...

item.title: ECB Defends Rate-Cutting Path in Face of Traders Paring Bets
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- The European Central Bank is pushing back against investors who reckon firmer inflation, a surprisingly sturdy US jobs market and Donald Trump’s economic disruption will narrow the scope to lower interest rates. While markets have pared bets on the number of cuts they expect this year...

item.title: Texas Ruling Opens Door to New Era of Scrutiny: ESG Investing
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- The 401(k) ruling against American Airlines Group Inc. for allegedly pursuing a “green” activism agenda is almost certain to add to the scrutiny facing ESG investment strategies. A US District Court judge in Texas said last week that the airline broke federal law by filling its 401(k)...
